events.originalText: The cryptocurrency network of bitcoin was created when Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first block of the chain.
events.subtitle: Cryptocurrency
events.headline: Satoshi Nakamoto mines first block of bitcoin network

events.originalText: Israeli forces seized MV Karine A, which was carrying 50 tonnes of smuggled weapons on behalf of the Palestinian National Authority.
events.subtitle: Karine A affair
events.headline: Israeli forces seize MV Karine A with smuggled weapons

events.originalText: The multilateral International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, part of the International Bill of Human Rights, came into effect.
events.subtitle: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights
events.headline: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights in effect

events.originalText: CBS announced the sale of the New York Yankees professional baseball team to a group of investors headed by American businessman George Steinbrenner.
events.subtitle: CBS
events.headline: CBS sells New York Yankees to group led by George Steinbrenner

events.originalText: All 25 people on board Aero Flight 311 died in Finland's worst civilian air accident when the aircraft crashed near Kvevlax.
events.subtitle: Aero Flight 311
events.headline: 25 killed in Aero Flight 311 crash in Finland

events.originalText: The American health charity March of Dimes was founded as the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis to help raise money for polio research.
events.subtitle: March of Dimes
events.headline: March of Dimes founded to raise money for polio research

events.originalText: A gun battle in the East End of London left two dead and sparked a political row over the operational involvement of Winston Churchill, then Home Secretary.
events.subtitle: Siege of Sidney Street
events.headline: Gun battle in London leaves two dead, sparks political row

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 7.7 Mw destroyed Almaty in Russian Turkestan.
events.subtitle: 1911 Kebin earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake destroys Almaty in Russian Turkestan

events.originalText: The 36-inch (91 cm) refracting telescope (pictured) at the Lick Observatory near San Jose, California, the largest in the world until 1897, was used for the first time.
events.subtitle: James Lick telescope
events.headline: Lick Observatory's 36-inch telescope used for first time

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: American forces under General George Washington defeated British troops at the Battle of Princeton.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: George Washington defeats British troops at Battle of Princeton

events.originalText: The first issue of Berlingske (front page pictured), Denmark's oldest continually operating newspaper, was published.
events.subtitle: Berlingske
events.headline: Denmark's oldest newspaper Berlingske publishes first issue

events.originalText: Pope Leo X issued the papal bull Decet Romanum Pontificem, excommunicating Martin Luther for refusing to retract 41 alleged errors found in his 95 Theses and other writings.
events.subtitle: Pope Leo X
events.headline: Pope Leo X excommunicates Martin Luther for 95 Theses

events.originalText: Emperor Decius ordered everyone in the Roman Empire (except Jews) to perform a sacrifice to the Roman gods, resulting in widespread persecution of Christians.
events.subtitle: Decius
events.headline: Emperor Decius orders sacrifice to Roman gods, persecuting Christians
